intro: Centotheca philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine centotheca, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Centotheca philippinensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
